intro: Crepis tybakiensis, commonly known as the Tybakiens crepis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of linear leaves and slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, dandelion-like yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a single head. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
